alert.note: Alert for Bell; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:50AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bell, central Knox and southeastern Whitley Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 750 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gausdale, or 9 miles southwest of Barbourville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hubbs and Swan Lake around 755 AM EDT. Barbourville, Myrick, Kayjay, Swanpond, Wheeler and Ingram around 800 AM EDT. Trosper, Avis, Himyar, Brush Creek, Artemus, Boone Heights, Yeager and Bimble around 805 AM EDT. Flat Lick, Old Flat Lick, Fourmile, Baughman, Wallsend, Wasioto and Clear Creek Springs around 810 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Pineville, Walker, Blanche, Dewitt, Cary, Rella, Arjay, Straight Creek, Barnyard and Scalf. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 25 East in Bell County between mile markers 10 and 18. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
